intro: Ocimum striatum, commonly known as the striated basil, is a species of flowering plant in the mint family, Lamiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive white or pale green stripe running along the midrib. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or pink in color, which bloom in clusters at the leaf axils. Ocimum striatum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and pleasant fragrance. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it adaptable to a variety of garden conditions.
